FAQ / Wave 4 / Battle Cards /
View On FortressMaximus.io

Involuntary Promotion

  1. What happens if the character I bring back from the KO area ends up with enough damage counters to KO it? [Source: WotC]
    Both characters will end up KO’d, but the character that started in the KO area will be on the battlefield for a short time. For example, any ability that triggers when Upgrades are moved onto that character will still happen. If that character has any revenge abilities, those abilities will also happen.
  2. Involuntary Promotion: if I play it and chose a tapped character, does the revived character come back tapped or untapped? [Source: WotC]
    Untapped.
  3. If I have a character with Bumpers attached, and I play Involuntary Promotion on a car in my KO area, does the returned character receive the Bumpers in time to prevent the damage counters from being moved? [Source: WotC]
    The damage and upgrades are moved at the same time. Bumpers’ effect won’t stop the damage counters from being moved.
  4. Can I KO a Battle Master with Involuntary Promotion if I have no bots in my KO area? [Source: WotC]
    Yes. If you have no characters in KO or the characters in your KO area have too many stars, you can use Involuntary Promotion to KO one of your characters.
  5. Regarding Involuntary Promotion trigger timings, when I shift the upgrade and damage counters to the returned character. Do I get to choose to shift the damage counters first followed by the upgrades since they are both my triggers? [Source: WotC]
    No part of Involuntary Promotion is a triggered ability. The instructions are all followed in order and the damage counters and upgrades are moved at the same time.
  6. Does Involuntary Promotion count as "repairing" the resurrected character? In other words, could Torox or Ratchet benefit from its play? [Source: WotC]
    No. The character appears on the Battlefield fully repaired. It’s not repaired while on the Battlefield.
